page.title: 15A DAY IN MY LIFE
page.content: We used to have two house cows, they were jersey cows, but their milk was too rich and creamy and we didn't like it. The farmers wife used to make us butter at the weekends and we had cream too. It took a long time to bring the cows in and milk them by hand twice a day and my father decided it was uneconomical and he sold them. We used to keep two pigs called Pinky and Perky to drink the wey milk but when the cows were sold they were sold too. Now we buy our milk in Wiveliscombe every day on our way to or from school. My mother makes bread sometimes, when she doesn't we buy it from the shops and deep freeze it. In the summer we go down to a fruit farm where we can pick strawberries and raspberries and then we make ice creama and jams with them.
